start.text: All stations, this is the Captain. General Quarters… yeah, again. You know the drill by now.
Here we go, kids. Another glorious day in the Navy.
Systems green. Just like the last seventeen times. Let's try not to die today.
Battle stations. Wake me when it's over.
All hands, man your stations. Same shit, different sector.

start_boss.text: Well look at that… another big bastard straight out of Hell. All right, let's dance.
I've seen worse. Hell, I've killed worse. Bring it on.
We didn't crawl out of the civil war graveyard just to get scrapped by this thing.
High-value target on scope. Finally something worth waking up for.

engaged.text: Weapons free. Let's get this over with.
Contact. Engaging… because apparently retirement isn't an option.
Batteries released. Try to make your shots count, people, I'm tired of overtime.
Birds away. If they miss I'm writing everyone up.
Here they come. Hold the line… or don't, I'm too old to care.

pursuing.text: They're running. Cute. Maintain pursuit, let's finish the paperwork.
Don't let them get away. I hate writing 'inconclusive' in the after-action.
Press the attack. They started this, we're ending it.
Running won't save you, pal. I've chased worse through worse.

running.text: Tactical withdrawal. Living is a victory these days.
Disengaging. I didn't survive thirty years to die for a bonus.
Bug out. There's no medal for being a dead hero.
Pulling back. Tell the Admiral he can come fight the next one himself.

hull_90.text: Took a love tap. Armor held. Barely noticed.
Minor hit. I've bled worse shaving.
Light damage. Damage control, coffee and a bandage, you'll be fine.
Hull's scratched. Like my soul, but functional.

hull_50.text: Fifty percent hull. Yep, feels about right for a Tuesday.
We're hurt. Not dead yet. Keep shooting.
Multiple hits. Damage control, earn your damn pay for once.
Half the ship left. Still more than I expected today.
Just like Athebyne all over again… hold together, you old bitch.

hull_30.text: Hull critical. Well… shit. Not like this, come on.
We're coming apart. I swear if I die now I'm haunting the yard that built this tub.
Thirty percent… I didn't survive the war for this bullshit.
Critical damage! All hands brace… and if we live, first round's on me.
She's dying. So am I, slowly. Let's not make it quick.

need_help.text: Any friendly this net, this is $shipNameNoPrefix, heavily engaged and getting lonely.
Could really use a hand here. Preferably one with guns.
Taking heavy fire. Where the hell is the rest of the fleet? Napping?
I'm not dying out here alone. Someone get your ass over here.

retreat.text: All units, bug out. This ain't the hill I'm dying on.
Disengage. I've got a bottle with my name on it back at port.
Tactical withdrawal. Tell command we're preserving experienced personnel.
We're done. Fall back before the paperwork gets worse.

out_of_missiles.text: VLS dry. Switching to guns. Back to the stone age, boys.
Missiles gone. Guess we do this the old-fashioned way.
Out of birds. Time to get in close and make it personal.
No more missiles. Great. Just like the budget hearings promised.

overload.text: Flux critical! Venting… because of course we are.
Capacitors spiking. Dropping shields… yeah, laugh it up.
Forced vent. Everyone hang on, Daddy's hungover.

death.text: Reactor going critical… tell the fleet we gave 'em hell… again…
She's breaking up… finally get to sleep…
This is $shipNameNoPrefix… going down… see you sorry bastards in hell…
Core breach… well, retirement at last…
I survived the civil war for this…? Figures…

victory.text: All contacts neutralized. We're still breathing. Miracles do happen.
They're gone. We're not. I'll take it.
Hostiles scrapped. Secure from GQ, someone find me a drink.
Another win in the books. Tastes like stale coffee and regret.
Clear. Good work. Now let's go home before they find us something else to kill.

victory_boss.text: Big bastard's dead. Just like Athebyne, only slower and uglier.
High-value target scrapped. The Alliance lives another day, somehow.
It's down. We're not. Buy your old man a whiskey when we make port.
Monster slain. Another scar, another story no one back home will believe.
